clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Etoricoxib to Treat Chronic Low Back Pain (0663-041)
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, 12-Week Trial to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of MK0663 in Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: Study the effect of etoricoxib 60 mg and 90 mg compared to placebo to treat chronic low back pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Low back pain intensity scale (0-100 mm VAS) over 4 weeks compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Low back pain intensity scale (0-100 mm VAS) over 12 weeks compared to placebo

intervention.intervention_name: MK0663, Etoricoxib / Duration of Treatment : 12 Weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Low back pain for previous 3 months and majority of days in last month
- Regular use of acetaminophen or NSAID to treat low back pain in past month
- Judged to be in otherwise good health
Exclusion Criteria:
- Low back pain that is due to secondary causes
- Radicular/myelopathic pain
- Surgery for low back pain within the past 6 months
- Active lawsuit or claim pertaining to their low back pain
- Disease that may confound the results of the study or pose risk to the patients
- Corticosteroid use in past month
- Previous participation in MK0663 study
